alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Franklin; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Lamoille, northeastern Orange, Caledonia, Orleans, southwestern Essex, northeastern Washington and eastern Franklin Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hyde Park to near Walden to Groton. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport City, St. Johnsbury, Island Pond, Lyndon, Morrisville, Orleans, Derby Center, Charleston, Johnson Village, Newport Town, Orange, Glover, Albany, Burke, Hyde Park, Greensboro Bend, Marshfield, Newark, Cabot Village and Brownington Village. This includes the following highways... Interstate 91 between mile markers 110 and 116, near mile marker 118, near mile marker 120, and between mile markers 123 and 173. Interstate 93 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central, northeastern and northwestern Vermont.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Franklin; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington
